sense.name: compass direction
sense.commentary: One of the four cardinal directions. Does not refer to a place. Most common usage.
sense.examples: I started walking to the east, knowing that I'd reach New York eventually. There's a storm coming from the east. The meteor landed somewhere to the east of here. Children learn the cardinal directions-- north, south, east, and west-- in school.

sense.name: place to the east
sense.commentary: Any place that lies to the east, when not referring specifically to Asia. Usually the eastern United States, if the speaker is from the United States.
sense.examples: People from the east are so stuck-up and arrogant! The east is full of trees and rocks.

sense.name: Asia
sense.commentary: The Orient, or the countries of Asia, in a general sense. Usually capitalized.
sense.examples: When Marco Polo returned to Europe, he brought some treasures from the East. The Cold War pitted the East against the West. Europeans view the East as a mysterious place of sensuality and danger.
